message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CE, cs.CL 

The paper presents a probabilistic model for personalized recommendation of lesson sequences in online education. The model uses access traces to learn a representation of students and educational content, which is similar to collaborative filtering for recommender systems. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves information retrieval (cs.IR) in the sense that it recommends educational content based on student interactions. The use of access traces also suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of computer engineering (cs.CE), which deals with the design and optimization of computer systems. Finally, the paper may also belong to the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL) since it involves natural language processing in the form of educational content.
